forecast.name: Today
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Sunny then Light Rain Likely
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 5pm. Mostly sunny, with a high near 58. West southwest wind 3 to 13 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. Southwest wind 8 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 30 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the morning unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, a cool grayness blankets the city, hinting at the rain that is steadily approaching. The chances of precipitation amplify as the day progresses, with skies cloaked in clouds that carry the promise of dampness. The air feels alive with anticipation, a fleeting moment of sunshine peeking through before the weather turns decidedly more somber in the evening. The wisps of fog are noticeable, intertwining with the iconic structures, and settling gently over the Bay, creating a soft, dream-like quality to the skyline.

Residents are advised to embrace layers, as the warmth of the day reaches a modest high, only to be followed by a chill once the sun takes its leave. A lightweight raincoat or an umbrella will serve well for those venturing out around the time the rain is set to arrive, while sturdy footwear might be prudent for navigating slick streets. As the rain taps the windows this evening, finding solace in a local café, perhaps with a well-worn book or in the company of friends, seems to be the most fitting way to enjoy the cozy ambiance that accompanies a rainy day in this vibrant city.
